name: Mercury
facts: Smallest planet in the Solar System.
Closest planet to the Sun.
Has no moons.

name: Venus
facts: Second planet from the Sun.
Known as the hottest planet in the Solar System.
Surface temperature can reach about 470°C (880°F).

name: Earth
facts: Third planet from the Sun.
Only known planet to support life.
Has one natural satellite, the Moon.

name: Mars
facts: Fourth planet from the Sun.
Often called the 'Red Planet' due to its reddish appearance.
Has the largest volcano and the deepest canyon in the Solar System.

name: Jupiter
facts: Fifth planet from the Sun.
Largest planet in the Solar System.
Has at least 79 known moons.

name: Saturn
facts: Sixth planet from the Sun.
Known for its prominent ring system.
Has the second-largest moon in the Solar System, Titan.

name: Uranus
facts: Seventh planet from the Sun.
Rotates on its side, with its axis almost parallel to its orbit.
Has a faint ring system and 27 known moons.

name: Neptune
facts: Eighth and farthest planet from the Sun.
Has the strongest winds in the Solar System, reaching speeds of up to 2,100 km/h (1,300 mph).
Discovered in 1846.
